item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Muriel Barbery
item.description: "There's so much humanity in a love of trees, so much nostalgia for our first sense of wonder, so much power in just feeling our own insignificance when we are surrounded by nature...yes, that's it: just thinking about trees and their indifferent majesty and our love for them teaches us how ridiculous we are - vile parasites squirming on the surface of the earth - and at the same time how deserving of life we can be, when we can honor this beauty that owes us nothing." -- Muriel Barbery

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "...I give you the mausoleum of all hope and desire...I give it to you not that you may remember time, but that you might forget it now and then for a moment and not spend all of your breath trying to conquer it. Because no battle is ever won he said. They are not even fought. The field only reveals to man his own folly and despair, and victory is an illusion of philosophers and fools." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Love doesn't die; the men and women do." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "People to whom sin is just a matter of words, to them salvation is just words too." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you are not long, I will wait for you all my life." -- Oscar Wilde
